intro: Peddiea montana, commonly known as the mountain peddiea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing structural support in its rugged habitat. Peddiea montana plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in mountainous regions.
